channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The British cruise liner, Lusitania, was sunk off the coast of Great Britain resulting in over 1000 deaths. The sinking contributed indirectly to the United States entering World War I.
item.title: From the Archives, 1915: The Lusitania is sunk by German torpedoes in WWI

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: After only 37 days on the turbulent Rugby Australia board, Peter Wiggs has quit his post.
item.title: Wiggs resigns from Rugby Australia board over CEO plans

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Genworth Mortgage Insurance Australia is bracing for a sharp rise in claims as the property market struggles and unemployment shoots up.
item.title: Genworth braces for higher claims with $181.8m write-down

item.description: Bid by Anthony Mokbel to avoid a two-week jail term after refusing to give evidence about fatal boxing match shooting is kicked up to Victoria's Supreme Court.
item.title: Supreme Court to hear Mokbel nephew's appeal against 14-day sentence

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: national death toll nears 100 including six in the state

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVIDSafe downloads top 5 million as Scott Morrison flags road to economic recovery, global COVID-19 cases surpass 3.5 million as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: The body of a woman has been found dumped in WA's Pilbara region, sparking a major police investigation.
item.title: Woman's body found dumped outside hospital in remote WA town

item.description: Four linked to Cedar Meats as state government plans its own Job-Keeper-style payment.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.description: Scott Morrison says players who refuse to get a flu shot should not be allowed on the field after Bryce Cartwright rejected a request to be vaccinated.
item.title: 'No jab, no play': PM says NRL should ban anti-vax stars from competing

item.dc:creator: Paul Byrnes
item.description: Hugo Weaving stars in a gripping movie that asks hard questions about the morals of war photography.
item.title: Ambitious new Australian film reflects on images of war

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: The faces were torn down from the tower in October last year after sun damage, blackening and tearing prompted transport authority safety concerns.
item.title: 'Creepy' Cockburn faces gone for good as Perth has its say

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: A Perth man accused of having sexually explicit conversations with a young girl will face court later this month after being charged by police.
item.title: Perth man to face court over online child exploitation allegation

item.description: Major League Baseball plan would reportedly eliminate the traditional American and National Leagues for 2020 and realign all six divisions for an abbreviated season.
item.title: MLB's radical plan for a shortened season

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: The Laidley case proves you don’t have to carry a gun to shoot yourself in the foot.
item.title: Sharing inside police goss, except there's no longer an inner circle

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Administration officials are telling taskforce members and their staff to expect the group to wind down within weeks, even as infections continue.
item.title: 'Exit stage left': White House to wind down coronavirus taskforce

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A proposed cyclist bridge at the bottom of the Kangaroo Point Cliffs will have a business case finished by early next year.
item.title: Kangaroo Point cycle bridge plan goes ahead with $1.6m price tag

item.description: The blaze at the 48-story Abbco Tower in Sharjah saw flaming debris shower neighbouring dusty parking lots and left metal siding littering surrounding streets.
item.title: High-rise tower catches fire in United Arab Emirates

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Brisbane City Council discussed the hotel's future in Tuesday's council meeting.
item.title: D-Day drags on for demolition of heritage Brisbane hotel

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: New photos of ancient dinosaur tracks in central Queensland has helped shed more light on the animal's behaviour.
item.title: Old photos shed new light on Queensland dinosaur tracks

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: Betting on index funds to get your exposure to sharemarkets may not be the optimal strategy during the pandemic.
item.title: Don't 'buy the index': Investing in the time of the coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: About 8.6% of Victorians lost their job last month - the most of any state. The government says it was inevitable Victoria would be hardest-hit.
item.title: Victoria's job losses due to nature of economy, not government failure: Treasurer

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Today it's expected the portion of Bradley Edwards' police interview will be played where detectives get his DNA results back from Pathwest and tell him his profile is a match to the DNA found under Ciara Glennon's fingernails.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Detectives confront accused after his DNA sample returns a 'match'

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The pay TV operator has signed a new exclusive multi-year agreement with WarnerMedia, which owns HBO programs including Game of Thrones and Succession and Warner Bros shows such as The Big Bang Theory and Friends.
item.title: Foxtel extends content deal with HBO, Warner Bros

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: Officials have been talking about returning to "normal" in June or July, but the country has now reported its largest single day number of infections.
item.title: Return to normal soon in doubt as Indonesian cases jump

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: Airfares for passengers out of Perth are set to plummet as Qantas looks to use its Jetstar budget brand to stimulate demand for travel once COVID-19 travel restrictions ease.
item.title: Post-pandemic Perth airfares to plummet as Qantas looks to get passengers on the move

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: South Sydney skipper Adam Reynolds has compared the treatment of Latrell Mitchell to Michael Jordan in a strident defence of the Rabbitohs superstar.
item.title: 'They nearly lost him': Reynolds compares Latrell 'harassment' to MJ

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: The race is on to develop fast and accurate antibody tests but questions remain about the lasting effects of any immunity to the disease.
item.title: Tens of millions of coronavirus antibody tests to be released in Europe

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The ACTU argues giving workers on minimum wage more money to spend will help the economy make a faster recovery.
item.title: Unions push for higher minimum wage, Porter warns it will cost jobs

item.dc:creator: Roy Masters
item.description: Rupert Murdoch could again be in control of rugby league as the brouhaha over the NRL's TV rights continues to play out in the public square.
item.title: Fox in the hole: NRL could go back to the future in TV merry-go-round

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Health authorities are under fire following revelations the first person in the meatworks COVID-19 cluster was diagnosed more than a month ago, but the abattoir was not told.
item.title: New cases linked to meatworks outbreak, as government defends handling

item.description: Standing in the marshalling area before the 4x100m freestyle relay final at the 2000 Games, Michael Klim should have been pumped up. Yet he started to get a sinking feeling.
item.title: Thorpe almost missed famous Olympic win over US: Klim

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The decision comes less than 24 hours after he declared he would run for the marginal federal seat.
item.title: Andrew Constance to withdraw from Eden-Monaro byelection

item.description: From the 'military method' to choosing to sleep on your left side, here are research-backed methods you can try when counting sheep just isn't cutting it.
item.title: Staying up later than normal? Here are seven ways to fall asleep fast

item.description: Marcus Bontempelli aims to stay genuine and authentic throughout an unusual start to life as Western Bulldogs captain during the AFL shutdown
item.title: Difficult times will make me a better captain: Bontempelli

item.description: Liberals fear that the eventual retirement of Ginsburg would allow Trump to nominate a more conservative justice, further shifting the balance of power of the court.
item.title: US Supreme Court Justice Ruth Ginsburg in hospital with infection: court

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The dismissal brings an abrupt end to three-year-long proceedings in a class action which was the first-ever Australian case by shareholders against a listed company to go to judgement.
item.title: Landmark Myer class action case dismissed

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: Former Premier League winner Samir Nasri says he was given carte blanche at Sevilla as long as he performed on the pitch.
item.title: 'You can drink, go to clubs': ex-EPL star Nasri's free rein in Spain

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Gallery of opinion illustrations and cartoons by Sydney Morning Herald artist, John Shakespeare.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist John Shakespeare

item.description: The Giro d'Italia and Vuelta a Espana will overlap in October under a new WorldTour calendar unveiled by cycling's world governing body the UCI on Tuesday.
item.title: Giro, Vuelta races to overlap in October

item.description: Sweden has reaped the benefits of keeping its economy out of lockdown after escaping the dramatic growth slumps suffered by European rivals.
item.title: Sweden's economy benefits from relaxed approach to COVID-19

item.description: Beyond the rallies and hand-painted signs, the movement's chief organisers have launched a less confrontational but more far-reaching information campaign.
item.title: Anti-vaccination leaders use coronavirus to push resistance to inoculation

item.description: Ian Foster, fresh from naming Sam Cane as New Zealand's new captain, has all but written off scheduled July home matches and is looking across the Tasman.
item.title: 'When borders open, we're playing': new-look All Blacks ready for Wallabies

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 is sitting 1 per cent lower at lunch time, with all sectors in red.
item.title: ASX down 1pc, banks and BHP drag

item.description: The coronavirus has decimated Disney's profit, but the next quarter is shaping to be even worse.
item.title: Disney suffers 90 per cent profit drop, and there is likely worse to come

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Electronics and hardware giant JB Hi-Fi delivered a bumper sales result for the March quarter, with spending soaring in the last nine days of the quarter.
item.title: JB Hi-Fi sales jump in pandemic thanks to working-from-home boom

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: Almost 40,000 WA properties are without power on Wednesday morning after the season’s first fierce storm packing winds of up to 128km/h took down power lines, razed fences and blew trampolines through Perth’s streets.
item.title: First powerful storm of the season leaves thousands without power and Perth littered in debris
